text: Ramanujan School of Mathematics ISI Entrance Mock Test 2 Budhaditya Halder May 2020 Total Marks: 80 Time: 2 hours 1. A natural number is called bright if it is the sum of a perfect square and a perfect cube. Prove that if r and s are any two positive integers, then (a) there exist inﬁnitely many positive integers n such that both r + n and s + n are bright. (b) there exist inﬁnitely many positive integers m such that both rm and sm are bright. 2. f : N → N is a function such that f (f (n)) = number of divisors of n ∀ n ∈ N. Prove that if p is a prime, then f (p) is a prime. 3. Find all continuous functions f : R → R such that for all reals x and y f (x + f (y)) = y + f (x + 1) 4. Let a, b and c be the side lengths of ∆ABC. The length of the altitudes are ha, hb and hc. Show that ha b + c + hb c + a + hc a + b ≤ 3 √ 3 4 5. We attempt to cover the plane with an inﬁnite sequence of rectangles {Rn}, overlapping allowed. (a) Is the task always possible if the area of Rn is n 2 for each n? (b) Is the task always possible if each rectangle is a square, and for any number N , there exist squares with total area greater than N ? 7. f : [0, 1] → R is a continuous function.
